strings:
<se_low>Yangus: Fancy people livin' in a place like this!
Blows your mind, dunnit!?

<se_high>Jessica: What a weird bunch of people!
But it's an interesting little village,
don't you think, <hero>?
<se_high>Jessica: Hah! I knew it! I know why YOU like it so much! You like the scanty outfits the women wear. I'm onto your little game!
<se_high>Jessica: You don't? But that stone gate thing's really amazing, don't you think?
<se_high>Jessica: That's what I think, anyway. But apparently you don't share my appreciation of beautiful and unique cultural relics... Oh well, your loss!
<se_def>Angelo: It seems this isn't a village of wild savages after all.
<se_def>Angelo: I had my doubts about an island cut off from the outside world, but this is a pleasant surprise.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya think this ‘Dark Eye’ thing's all about then, eh? I ain't got a clue.
<se_high>Jessica: If we want to fight Rhapthorne, we're going to need Empyrea's help.
<se_high>Jessica: But how can we talk to a shadow?
<se_high>Jessica: I guess we should just cross that bridge when we come to it. We'd better find her shadow first.
<se_def>Angelo: I don't think we should necessarily pay too much attention to someone as senile<endash> ...I mean, senior, as that old man.
<se_def>Angelo: It all sounds a bit far-fetched to me. Superstition, at best. But superfluous gibberish would probably be closer to the truth.
<se_low>Yangus: Quiet as ever, eh, this village!
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' around, ya start to think maybe it's all a dream. Ya know, goin' to another world an' all that.
<se_high>Jessica: I think we've done all we can do here in the village.
<se_high>Jessica: Now we need to go to this World of Darkness place! We should set out right away!

<se_def>Angelo: Fair-skinned maidens are nice, of course,
but I rather like the healthy glow of these bronzed beauties.
<se_def>Angelo: Then again, I'd feel more at home at the Baccarat bar, having a good time with the bunnies. More my style.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder wot's goin' on in this village in the World o' Darkness?<page>Yangus: I mean, there it's all doom 'n' gloom, but 'ere it's all sunshine 'n' smiles, ain't it?
<se_high>Jessica: Empyrea must be worried sick about her egg.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's rescue it and put her mind at ease!
<se_def>Angelo: The name might be the same, but Light Empycchu and Dark Empycchu couldn't be more different.
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose Empyrea's rampage goes some way to explaining it, but Light Empycchu is so much more animated and engaging than its Dark counterpart.
<se_def>Angelo: But maybe I'm biased, coming as I do from the World of Light!
<se_low>Yangus: The legend of Empyrea's been passed down the generations 'ere, ever since they 'ad all that trouble wiv the Lord o' Darkness way back.
<se_low>Yangus: An' if they hadn't passed it on to us, we'd never 'ave met 'er, she'd never 'ave asked for 'elp an' 'er chick would never 'ave let us fly.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot I'm tryin' to say is, we owe 'em.
<se_high>Jessica: Remember how the sea chart we found in the Pirate's Cove guided us to this island?

<se_high>Jessica: Now I wonder if Captain Crow was looking
for Empyrea's help, too.
Maybe that's why he left the map in his cave?

<se_def>Angelo: Fair-skinned maidens are nice, of course,
but I rather like the healthy glow of these bronzed beauties.
<se_def>Angelo: Then again, I'd feel more at home at the Baccarat bar, having a good time with the bunnies. More my style.
<se_low>Yangus: Ah, thank 'eavens Empycchu's awright!

<se_low>Yangus: It's ironical really, ain't it?
They worship Empyrea 'ere, but she couldn't do nuffin' to protect them an' the village.
<se_low>Yangus: I really thought the 'ole place'd be a burnt-out wreck by now.
<se_high>Jessica: For some reason I expected the people of Empycchu to stay calm in the face of what's happening to the world.
<se_high>Jessica: But they're just as tense as people everywhere else. More, perhaps.

<se_high>Jessica: Then again, I'm sure they're only getting incomplete reports of what's happening.
That would make anyone jumpy.
<se_def>Angelo: With all these folk tales of the great struggle they had with Rhapthorne, you'd have thought someone might have given us a clue about his weaknesses.

<se_def>Angelo: But there's not even a hint of a hint.
That's exactly what I dislike about folk tales.
They always leave out the juicy bits!
<se_high>Red: Hmph. This place is awright, eh? Nice an' quiet.

<se_high>Red: If things weren't such a flamin' mess,
I could put me feet up 'ere for a while.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe in this village there is someone who can light our shed about the big shadow we see before, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: I cannot stop to think about this shadow.
It is in my thoughts all the time.
It is driving me crazy!
...Maybe this is a love, ay?
<se_def>Angelo: Personally, I prefer the object of my affections to be a little more...physical.
<se_high>Red: This World o' Darkness is a funny old place, eh? S'pose we better follow that Empyrea-wotsit's shadow an' see where it gets us...
<se_low>Morrie: The gigantesca shadow, it was from the Godbird, ay? She is guiding us up the path to the World of the Darkness?
<se_low>Morrie: I cannot imagine what is lying in the waiting room for us in this new world. But I am sure there will be many monsters we have never seen before! FANTASTICO!
<se_high>Red: If we wanna make any progress, we'll prob'ly 'ave better luck in the World o' Darkness than 'angin' around 'ere, right?
<se_low>Morrie: The divine bird, Empyrea, has expended us with an invitazione, ay? We must <endash> How do you say it? <endash> shake our legs, ay?
<se_high>Red: For the love o' the Goddess, wot are you playin' at now? We're s'posed to be fightin' Gemon, right? Come on, back to the World o' Darkness!
<se_low>Morrie: We must save the bambino of the divine bird, ay? Allora, we go now to the World of the Darkness and fight the enemy in the nest!

<se_high>Red: I reckon we'll be seein' a fair bit more of Empyrea. She's gonna be the key to defeatin'
the Lord o' Darkness, if you ask me.
That's wot me gut's tellin' me.
<se_low>Morrie: The divine bird was MAGNIFICO! So much POWER! Si, I am wanting to ask her to come to my pit. To join my monster team.

<se_high>Red: Them old legends are all the same, eh?
Good fightin' evil and the 'ero savin' the day in the end.
<se_high>Red: S'pose it's cos they're passed down by word o' mouth. No one bothers tellin' the borin' stories. Or if they do, no one else bothers repeatin' 'em.
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, if there is this village where the people are idolising the Empyrea, maybe some place there is a village where they are idolising the Rhapthorne.
<se_low>Morrie: And maybe they are thinking he is the leggendario deity, and WE and Empyrea are the black caps, ay? CRAZY!
